parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant

parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header UUID
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant-UUID

parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.description: DnsPolicy object creation
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: object name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

begin.description: Starting IP address of the range.

end.description: Ending IP address of the range.

geolocation_name.description: Geographical location of the client IP to be used in the match. This location is of the format Country/State/City e.g. US/CA/Santa Clara. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

use_edns_client_subnet_ip.description: Use the IP address from the EDNS client subnet option, if available, to derive geo location of the DNS query. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

geolocation_tag.description: Geolocation tag for the client IP. This could be any string value for the client IP, e.g. client IPs from US East Coast geolocation would be tagged as 'East Coast'. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

match_criteria.description: Criterion to use for matching the client IP's geographical location. Enum options - IS_IN, IS_NOT_IN. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

group_refs.description: UUID of IP address group(s). It is a reference to an object of type IpAddrGroup.

match_criteria.description: Criterion to use for IP address matching the HTTP request. Enum options - IS_IN, IS_NOT_IN.

ip_addr.description: Placeholder for description of property ip_addr of obj type IpAddrPrefix field type str  type object

query_type.description: DNS query types in the request query . Enum options - DNS_RECORD_OTHER, DNS_RECORD_A, DNS_RECORD_NS, DNS_RECORD_CNAME, DNS_RECORD_SOA, DNS_RECORD_PTR, DNS_RECORD_HINFO, DNS_RECORD_MX, DNS_RECORD_TXT, DNS_RECORD_RP, DNS_RECORD_DNSKEY, DNS_RECORD_AAAA, DNS_RECORD_SRV, DNS_RECORD_OPT, DNS_RECORD_RRSIG, DNS_RECORD_AXFR, DNS_RECORD_ANY. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

match_criteria.description: Criterion to use for matching the DNS query typein the question section. Enum options - IS_IN, IS_NOT_IN. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

index.description: Index of the rule. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

enable.description: Enable or disable the rule. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

log.description: Log DNS query upon rule match. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

action.description: Action to be performed upon successful matching. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

match.description: Add match criteria to the rule. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

name.description: Name of the rule. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

reset_conn.description: Reset the TCP connection of the DNS query, if allow is set to false to drop the query. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

allow.description: Allow the DNS query. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

use_edns_client_subnet_ip.description: Use the IP address from the EDNS client subnet option, if available, as the source IP address of the client. It should be noted that the edns subnet IP may not be a /32 IP address. Field introduced in 17.1.6,17.2.2.

client_ip.description: IP addresses to match against client IP. Field introduced in 17.1.6,17.2.2.

ip6_address.description: IPv6 address for FQDN. Field introduced in 18.1.1.
IPv6 address for Name Server. Field introduced in 18.1.1.

ip_address.description: IP address for Name Server. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

nsname.description: Name Server name. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

protocol.description: Protocol to match against transport protocol used by DNS query. Enum options - DNS_OVER_UDP, DNS_OVER_TCP. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

match_criteria.description: Criterion to use for matching the DNS transport protocol. Enum options - IS_IN, IS_NOT_IN. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

pool_ref.description: Reference of the pool to serve the passthrough DNS query which cannot be served locally. It is a reference to an object of type Pool. Field introduced in 18.1.3, 17.2.12.

pool_group_ref.description: Reference of the pool group to serve the passthrough DNS query which cannot be served locally. It is a reference to an object of type PoolGroup. Field introduced in 18.1.3, 17.2.12.

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

name.description: Name of the DNS Policy. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type Tenant. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

uuid.description: UUID of the DNS Policy. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

resource_record_set.description: DNS resource record set - (records in the resource record set share the DNS domain name, type, and class). Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

section.description: DNS message section for the resource record set. Enum options - DNS_MESSAGE_SECTION_QUESTION, DNS_MESSAGE_SECTION_ANSWER, DNS_MESSAGE_SECTION_AUTHORITY, DNS_MESSAGE_SECTION_ADDITIONAL. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

query_domain_names.description: Domain name to match against that specified in the question section of the DNS query. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

string_group_refs.description: UUID of the string group(s) for matching against DNS query domain name in the question section. It is a reference to an object of type StringGroup. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

match_criteria.description: Criterion to use for string matching the DNS query domain name in the question section. Enum options - BEGINS_WITH, DOES_NOT_BEGIN_WITH, CONTAINS, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN, ENDS_WITH, DOES_NOT_END_WITH, EQUALS, DOES_NOT_EQUAL, REGEX_MATCH, REGEX_DOES_NOT_MATCH. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

is_site_preferred.description: When set to true, GSLB site is a preferred site. This setting comes into play when the site is down, as well as no configured fallback site is available (all fallback sites are also down), then any one available site is selected based on the default algorithm for GSLB pool member selection. Field introduced in 17.2.5.

site_name.description: GSLB site name. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

fallback_site_names.description: GSLB fallback sites to use in case the desired site is down. Field introduced in 17.2.5.

authoritative.description: DNS response is authoritative. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

rcode.description: DNS response code. Enum options - DNS_RCODE_NOERROR, DNS_RCODE_FORMERR, DNS_RCODE_SERVFAIL, DNS_RCODE_NXDOMAIN, DNS_RCODE_NOTIMP, DNS_RCODE_REFUSED, DNS_RCODE_YXDOMAIN, DNS_RCODE_YXRRSET, DNS_RCODE_NXRRSET, DNS_RCODE_NOTAUTH, DNS_RCODE_NOTZONE. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

resource_record_sets.description: DNS resource record sets - (resource record set share the DNS domain name, type, and class). Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

truncation.description: DNS response is truncated. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

query_name.description: Domain names to match against query name. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

client_ip.description: IP addresses to match against client IP. From 17.1.6 release onwards, IP addresses needs to be configured in the client_ip_address field of this message. Field deprecated in 17.1.6,17.2.2. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

geo_location.description: Geographical location attribute to match against that of the client IP. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

protocol.description: DNS transport protocol match. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

client_ip_address.description: IP addresses to match against client IP or the EDNS client subnet IP. Field introduced in 17.1.6,17.2.2.

query_type.description: DNS query types to match against request query type. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

pool_switching.description: Select a pool or pool group for the passthrough DNS query which cannot be served locally but could be served by upstream servers. Field introduced in 18.1.3, 17.2.12.

allow.description: Allow or drop the DNS query. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

gslb_site_selection.description: Select a specific GSLB site for the DNS query. This action should be used only when GSLB services have been configured for the DNS virtual service. Field introduced in 17.1.5.

response.description: Generate a response for the DNS query. Field introduced in 17.1.1.

cname.description: Canonical name in CNAME record. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

ip6_addresses.description: IPv6 address in AAAA record. Field introduced in 18.1.2.

ip_addresses.description: IP address in A record. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

ttl.description: Time To Live for this DNS record. Allowed values are 0-2147483647. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

type.description: DNS record type. Enum options - DNS_RECORD_OTHER, DNS_RECORD_A, DNS_RECORD_NS, DNS_RECORD_CNAME, DNS_RECORD_SOA, DNS_RECORD_PTR, DNS_RECORD_HINFO, DNS_RECORD_MX, DNS_RECORD_TXT, DNS_RECORD_RP, DNS_RECORD_DNSKEY, DNS_RECORD_AAAA, DNS_RECORD_SRV, DNS_RECORD_OPT, DNS_RECORD_RRSIG, DNS_RECORD_AXFR, DNS_RECORD_ANY. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

fqdn.description: Fully Qualified Domain Name. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.

nses.description: Name Server information in NS record. Field introduced in 17.2.12, 18.1.2.
